The ultimate test of our society is how we treat our fellow human beings, especially those who we have previously left behind.

We’ve got to build an economy that welcomes people with disabilities, values their work, rewards them fairly, and treats them with respect.

In America, every person, no matter what you look like or who you are, should have the chance to go as far as your dreams will take you.
We need to come together to turn the tide, stop violence, build trust, and give all our kids the chance to grow up safe and healthy.

As Secretary, Hillary implemented reforms to protect diplomats and help prevent future attacks. #BenghaziCommitteehttps://amp.twimg.com/v/663e6021-1867-40eb-b553-fcc67b48e089 …
To truly honor those lost at Benghazi, we need to do everything in our power to ensure the safety of the brave Americans who do their work.
America must do all we can to protect our personnel doing the important work of representing our interests and values around the world.
The work of Chris Stevens and his colleagues represented the best of this approach to foreign policy.
America must pursue a smart brand of leadership that integrates and balances the tools of diplomacy, development, and defense.
We cannot return to the go-it-alone foreign policy of the past, where military-based solutions are pursued as a first option.
American diplomats cannot conduct their work from bunkers. Advancing US interests often means going to unstable regions.
Hillary is testifying before @HouseBenghazi to defend the vision of US diplomacy that Ambassador Stevens gave his life carrying out.
America must continue to lead in a dangerous world. To do otherwise would mean drawing the wrong lesson from the Benghazi tragedy.
A lesson from Benghazi: Congress needs to do its part to ensure that our diplomats in dangerous parts of the world are as safe as possible.
We need leadership that puts national security ahead of politics and ideology. #BenghaziCommitteehttps://amp.twimg.com/v/7d3d54c3-c40f-4856-9421-303a23f37666 …
Hillary this morning at the House Select Committee on Benghazi.pic.twitter.com/ZxhcSJVAfI
"The American people expect us to lead. To learn the right lessons. To rise above partisanship and reach for statesmanship." —Hillary
"I am here, despite all the previous investigations...to honor those we lost and to do what I can to aid those who serve us still." —Hillary
"We should debate on the basis of fact, not fear. We should resist denigrating the patriotism or loyalty of those who disagree with us."
America "has a long history of bipartisan cooperation on foreign policy...I know it’s possible to find common ground because I’ve done it."
"We need leadership at home to match our leadership abroad. Leadership that puts national security ahead of politics and ideology." —Hillary
"Efforts to establish a modern joint training center are being held up by Congress. The men and women who serve our country deserve better."
"There is more to do, and no administration can do it alone. Congress has to be our partner as it has been after previous tragedies."
"I pledged that...every one [of the Accountability Review Board's recommendations] would be on the way to implementation. And they were."
"We have a responsibility to provide diplomats with the resources & support they need to do their jobs as safely & effectively as possible."
Hillary on fallen Americans in Libya: "They believed—as I do—that America is greatest force for peace & progress the world has ever known."
"We need creative, confident...leadership that integrates and balances the tools of diplomacy, development, and defense." —Hillary
"Retreat from the world is not an option. America cannot shrink from our responsibility to lead." —Hillary
"We have learned the hard way when America is absent, especially from unstable places, there are consequences." —Hillary #BenghaziCommittee
"If you ask our most experienced ambassadors, they’ll tell you they can’t do their jobs for us from bunkers." —Hillary
Hillary at the #BenghaziCommittee.pic.twitter.com/Op750p9avA
"We inevitably must accept a level of risk to protect our country and advance our interests and values." —Hillary
"America must lead in a dangerous world, and our diplomats must continue representing us in dangerous places." —Hillary
"Today I would like to share three observations about how we can learn from this tragedy and move forward as a nation." —Hillary
"I launched reforms to better protect our people in the field and help reduce the chances of another tragedy happening." —Hillary
"I am here to honor the service of those four men...and the work their colleagues do every single day all over the world." —Hillary

Today, we handed our account to Sara to celebrate #ADA25 and what it means for families. Read it on @Storify:http://hrc.io/1MuW2sQ
Sara: Thanks for sharing your story with us on #ADA25. Your work every day - as a mom, nurse, and advocate - is an inspiration to us all. -H
Thanks for listening. Follow along at @HillaryforIA as we celebrate #ADA25! —Sarapic.twitter.com/Do6PFzytwb
Today on the 25th anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act, Adam, Dale & I are thrilled to spend the day with Hillary. #ADA25
We know Hillary’s a fighter & that she’ll fight for Adam as President just like she did at the Children’s Defense Fund & in Congress.
Iowa's @SenatorHarkin co-authored the ADA. We're proud to have been represented by such a strong champion for people with disabilities.
Later that night, she joined us to talk about the big questions that really need to be asked—for Adam, and for everyone fighting for a cure.
"What do we have here?" she asked. Adam's father came over, thanking Hillary for her commitment to epilepsy research with a hug.
I’ll never forget the first time Adam met Hillary. At a dinner in 2007, Adam broke away from us & ran up to her.
Adam's teacher said, "We’ll make it happen—that's our job." The rest is history. He has loved, loved it.
She told me that he was a great runner! I just thought, "How would this happen?" I knew it should happen, but I also knew the challenges.
We’re grateful for supportive teachers. In junior high, his PE teacher called & asked if Adam would go for cross country.
For Adam, that means enjoying cross country. At meets, other teams run him in & congratulate him. It's neat to see!pic.twitter.com/YGk4krihuz
Through Adam, we informally raise awareness for people with disabilities every day: It's as simple as taking pride in the small things.
We’ll rely on organizations in our community, because Adam will need training, direction & safety as an adult.
One thing that concerns us as Adam gets older is what happens after he finishes school.
The ADA ensures Adam & Turbo are welcome everywhere. Turbo even joined us at Wrigley Field for a @Cubs game!pic.twitter.com/msnZm7FcRg
Adam’s service dog Turbo is a huge part of our lives. He goes everywhere with Adam, including school.
He’s always doing that.pic.twitter.com/dQKmLOtkCw
During the school year, Adam's a member of the cross country team. I never imagined he'd be a runner like me & Dale, but he proved us wrong.
His father Dale & I work, so Adam spends summer days at @TheArcUS. Yesterday we celebrated ADA Night at @CRKernels!pic.twitter.com/n8ysuMoseC
My son Adam has Lennox-Gastaut Syndrome, a form of epilepsy. The ADA helps him to live life to the fullest, each & every day. #ADA25
I’m Sara—mom, nurse & lifelong Iowan. I'm taking over @HillaryClinton today for the 25th anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act.
Thrilled to hear HHS announced $100 million to help states address opioid abuse & expand treatment. This is an epidemic we must end. -H

Share this → Hillary's vision to raise incomes for hardworking Americans—in one infographic: http://hillaryforhigherincomes.tumblr.com pic.twitter.com/CGdBVqEBBE
Let's build an economy that works for everyone. Join Hillary: http://hrc.io/economy pic.twitter.com/qDSTlIljsJ
"I’m running for President to build an America for tomorrow, not yesterday—where if you do your part, you will reap the rewards."—Hillary
"Above all, we have to break out of the poisonous partisan gridlock and focus on the long-term needs of our country."
"Let's get back to making decisions that rely on evidence more than ideology."
"I will appoint and empower regulators who understand that Too Big To Fail is still too big a problem."
"I will offer plans to rein in excessive risk on Wall Street and ensure that stock markets work for everyday investors."
"Too often it has seemed that the human beings responsible get off with limited consequences...This is wrong—& on my watch, it will change."
Hillary on misconduct in the financial industry: "There can be no justification or tolerance for this kind of criminal behavior."
"Workers are assets. Investing in them pays off. Higher wages pay off. And training pays off."
"Too many pressures in our economy today are pushing us toward short-termism."pic.twitter.com/AgJQAOjBB9
"The third key driver of income gains alongside strong growth and fair growth must be long-term growth."pic.twitter.com/3wz5pKFic7
"When all Americans have the chance to study hard, work hard, and share in our country’s prosperity—that’s fair growth."
"To create fair growth, we need to create opportunity for more Americans."pic.twitter.com/zt177GbuwG
"If we want to get serious about raising incomes, we have to get serious about supporting union workers."
"I will propose ways to encourage companies to share profits with their employees. That's good for workers, and good for businesses."
"To get all incomes rising again, we need to strike a better balance. If you work hard, you ought to be paid fairly."

"Let him tell that to the fast food workers marching in the streets for better pay.

They don’t need a lecture—they need a raise."
"You may have heard Gov. Bush say last week that Americans just need to work longer hours. He must not have met very many American workers."
"The evidence is in: Inequality is a drag on our entire economy. This is the problem we need to tackle."pic.twitter.com/Q6Bbhwbtb6
"As President, I’ll fight to put families first—just like I have my entire career."
"For far too long, these challenges have been dismissed by some as 'women’s issues.' Well, those days are over."
"It’s way past time to end the outrage of so many women still earning less than men on the job—and women of color making even less."
"It’s time to recognize that quality, affordable child care is not a luxury—it’s a growth strategy."
"When we leave people out, or write them off, we not only shortchange them—we shortchange our country and shortchange our future."
"We can’t afford to leave talent on the sidelines."pic.twitter.com/wD2Bm5iA3e
Another key to strong growth that often goes overlooked & undervalued: Breaking down barriers to joining the workforce—especially for women.
"There’s no excuse not to make greater investments in cleaner, renewable energy right now."
"Bringing millions of hard-working people into the formal economy would increase our GDP by an estimated $700 billion over 10 years."
"I know it’s not always how we think about this, but another engine of strong growth should be comprehensive immigration reform."
"More growth means more jobs and more new businesses."pic.twitter.com/Fl4eGGalIW
"Today I am proposing an agenda to raise incomes for hard-working Americans. An agenda for strong growth, fair growth, & long-term growth."
"I want to see our economy work for the struggling, the striving, and the successful."pic.twitter.com/zfZSkwCzYg
"The measure of our success must be how much incomes rise for hard-working families—not just for successful CEOs and money managers."
"As President, I will work with every possible partner to turn the tide—to make these currents of change start working for us."
"[Changes in our economy] don’t determine our destiny. The choices we make as a nation matter."
"The defining economic challenge of our time is clear: We must raise incomes for hard-working Americans."pic.twitter.com/nt3xYtbMSd
Wages need to rise to keep up with costs. Paychecks need to grow. Families who work hard & do their part deserve to get ahead & stay ahead.
"I believe we have to build a 'growth and fairness' economy. You can’t have one without the other."
We can’t go back to the old policies that failed us before.pic.twitter.com/HtNAREtpsZ
"For 35 years, Republicans have argued that if we give more wealth to those at the top...it will trickle down to everyone else."
"That bargain has eroded. Our job is to make it strong again."pic.twitter.com/T3ARkHJRsz
"If you work hard and do your part, you should be able to get ahead. And when you get ahead, America gets ahead."
"I’ve had the opportunity to listen to Americans’ concerns about an economy that still isn’t delivering for them the way it should."—Hillary

Business can be a powerful force of change—there’s something significant in the community work we do. I'm proud to create jobs & give back.
One of my favorite & proudest things as a business owner is our pro-bono work. Every year, we donate a year's worth of work to a non-profit.
The Wall of Inspiration: Staff members select who inspires them & we put them up. (Can you spot me & Gloria Steinem?)pic.twitter.com/T1uHZwGdEk
We're really proud of our space because we built it together. Now, clients bring us things to add to the "museum."pic.twitter.com/0X5UGpaLPE
We should remove barriers so we can focus on the important things: Supporting employees, doing good work, & contributing to our communities.
Owning a business—managing projects, budgets, and people—is a lot of work. The people aspect can be the toughest and the most rewarding.
I never meant to start a company. I studied fine art at UNH (to my parents' horror)—but I was lucky to have the support to do what I loved.
The best part of owning my own business: It enabled me to become a single mom at 40, and gives me security & flexibility to be a mom now.
